org.jrouteros.core.auth

Class AuthService

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jrouteros.core.auth.AuthService

  • public class AuthService
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used for accessing class Talker, with this class you can specify way of authentication to MikroTik RouterOS API.
    Author:
    Lalu Erfandi Maula Yusnu

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AuthService() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Auth getAuth()
      Get Auth Object based on type
      Talker getRouterOSTalker()
      Get Talker for executing command to MikroTik RouterOS
      void setAuthType(java.lang.String type)
      There are 4 (four) type that are valid, direct, xml, and sqllite.
      If you write direct then you just access one time QueryService for accessing MikroTik API.
      If you write xml, you have to specify path of xml file that you've created before with method setXMLPathFile(String).
      If you write properties, you have to specify path of properties file that you've created before with method setPropertiesPathFile(String)
      void setDirect(Auth authObject)
      Set Direct Configuration for Authentication to MikroTik RouterOS
      void setPropertiesPathFile(java.lang.String pathToPropertiesFile) 
      void setXMLPathFile(java.lang.String pathToXMLFile)
      Set XMl File Configuration for Authentication to MikroTik RouterOS

      • AuthService

        public AuthService()

    • Method Detail

      • setAuthType

        public void setAuthType(java.lang.String type)
        There are 4 (four) type that are valid, direct, xml, and sqllite.
        If you write direct then you just access one time QueryService for accessing MikroTik API.
        If you write xml, you have to specify path of xml file that you've created before with method setXMLPathFile(String).
        If you write properties, you have to specify path of properties file that you've created before with method setPropertiesPathFile(String)
        Parameters:
        type - String

      • setXMLPathFile

        Set XMl File Configuration for Authentication to MikroTik RouterOS
        Parameters:
